channel.title: debian on sdcard with grub-live not boot
channel.description: Hi guys. I installed debian 10 buster on sdcard. It is work. But i installed grub-live, and i select live mode in grub menu, but the system does not boot. https:*//i.*ibb.*co/cJCRrs4/2.*png (delete *)

item.title: debian on sdcard with grub-live not boot
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.source: debian on sdcard with grub-live not boot

item.title: debian on sdcard with grub-live not boot
item.dc:creator: seekeroftruth
item.description:
Thanks for the answer. I will look for a solution to the problem.
Did other users have a similar problem?

Read full topic
item.source: debian on sdcard with grub-live not boot

item.title: debian on sdcard with grub-live not boot
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I have no idea. Don’t except a solution.

Note: grub-live isn’t a totally new invention by Whonix. You’re in no way asking the only people who might know this. Packaging aside, grub-live is effectively just under 30 lines of code. Package grub-live is merely an usability enhancement of existing functionality. I am not saying it was easy to invent but there core parts were even harder and developed elsewhere. Therefore you have the option of going back to the origin, Debian Live Project.

By comparsion, an arbitrarily chosen Debian live-config script is ~ 330 lines of code and in folder /lib/live/boot alone there are 24 scripts.

Read full topic
item.source: debian on sdcard with grub-live not boot

/boot/grub/grub.cfg

At least the part 10_linux and 11_linux_live
